briefdescription.para: An unsigned long integer indicating the number of realizations to simulate.
An unsigned long integer indicating the number of weeks to simulate.
An unsigned long integer indicating the row of the decision variables to simulate.
An unsigned long integer indicating the number of threads to use in the optimization.
An integer indicating the number of utilities in the problem.
A string containing the input/output directory for the problem.
A string containing the output subdirectory path for the problem.
A string containing the output filename suffix unique to the problem. FIXME: Need to correct variable name to fname_suffix.
A string containing the filename suffix for the evaporation and inflow files unique to the problem.
A string containing the filename suffix for the demand files unique to the problem.
A srting containing the filename for the demand files subfolder.
A string containing the directory to the ROF tables.
A vector of unsigned long integers containing the indices realizations to run.
A pointer to the MasterDataCollector object.
A vector of doubles containing the objective values for the problem.
A boolean flag indicating whether or not to print the output files.
An integer indicating the DU SOW index.
An integer indicating the ROF table import/export/ignore option. -1: Import tables, 0: Ignore tables, 1: Export tables.
A double indicating the multiplier for the table generation storage.
A 2D vector of doubles storing the DU multipliers for all utilities' demand growth rates.
A 2D vector of doubles storing the DU multipliers for all water sources' permitting and construction times.
A 2D vector of doubles storing the DU multipliers for all utilities' water restriction policy effectiveness.
A 2D vector of matrices storing the ROF tables for all utilities across all realizations.
An unsigned long flag indicating which problem formulation to run.

memberdef.argsstring: (vector< int > *order, vector< double > *trigger, int id_low, int id_high, double capacity_low, double capacity_high)
memberdef.name: checkAndFixInfraExpansionHighLowOrder

briefdescription.para: Prioritizes or merges infrastructure low and high expansions. If the high-expansion version is prioritized (appears earlier in the list), both the capacities of the low and high expansions are combined. The lower-priority item is removed from all lists.

parameterdescription.para: A pointer to a vector<int> object containing the construction order of infraRank objects.
A pointer to a vector<double> object containing the triggers that result in the construction of each corresponding infraRank vector object.
The ID of the low-expansion infrastructure.
The ID of the high-expansion infrastructure.
The capacity of the low-expansion infrastructure.
The capacity of the high-expansion infrastructure.

simplesect.para: double The combined capacity of the low and high expansions if the high-expansion infrastructure is prioritized. Otherwise, return the original capacity of the high-expansion infrastructure.

briefdescription.para: Converts the vector of infraRank objects to a vector of integers.

parameterdescription.para: A vector of infraRank objects.

simplesect.para: vector<int> A vector of integers denoting each infrastructure's rank (from earliest to last built) after optimization.

briefdescription.para: Constructs a new Problem object. Unset the seed for the random number generator for the reservoir objects. NOTE: Unclear what this does; need to see if can delete.

parameterdescription.para: The number of weeks to simulate.

briefdescription.para: Destructor for the Problem object.
Sets the number of weeks over which to simulate the problem.

parameterdescription.para: An integer indicating the number of simulation weeks.

briefdescription.para: Sets the row of the decision variables of the solution (the solution number) to simulate.

parameterdescription.para: An unsigned long integer indicating the row of the decision variables to simulate.

briefdescription.para: Sets the input/output directory for the problem.

parameterdescription.para: A const reference to the string containing the input/output directory for the problem.

briefdescription.para: Set the output subdirectory path for the problem.

parameterdescription.para: A string containing the output subdirectory path.

briefdescription.para: Gets the values of all the objectives for the current solution.
Calculates the objectives for the current solution. Prints them to a file if indicated as such.

parameterdescription.para: Boolean flag to indicate if the output files should be printed.

simplesect.para: vector<double> The calculated objectives for each utility.

memberdef.argsstring: (vector< vector< double >> &utilities_rdm, vector< vector< double >> &water_sources_rdm, vector< vector< double >> &policies_rdm)
memberdef.name: setRDMOptimization

briefdescription.para: Sets the 2D vectors of deeply uncertain factors for the problem optimization.

parameterdescription.para: The reference to a 2D vector of DU factors for the short, middle, long-term and overall demand growth rate multipliers applied across all utilities //FIX: RENAME TO BETTER INDICATE RELATION TO DEMAND.
The reference to a 2D vector of DU factors that scale the permitting and construction time of new water sources and the corresponding evaporation rate multipliers.
The reference to a 2D vector of DU factors that scale the effectiveness of water use restriction policies.

memberdef.argsstring: (int rdm_no, vector< vector< double >> &utilities_rdm, vector< vector< double >> &water_sources_rdm, vector< vector< double >> &policies_rdm)
memberdef.name: setRDMReevaluation

briefdescription.para: Sets the 2D vectors of deeply uncertain factors for the problem reevaluation.

parameterdescription.para: An integer indicating the DU SOW index.
The reference to a 2D vector of DU factors for the short, middle, long-term and overall demand growth rate multipliers applied across all utilities
The reference to a 2D vector of DU factors that scale the permitting and construction time of new water sources and the corresponding evaporation rate multipliers.
The reference to a 2D vector of DU factors that scale the effectiveness of water use restriction policies.

briefdescription.para: Sets the number of threads to use in the problem optimization.

parameterdescription.para: An unsigned long integer indicating the number of threads to use.

briefdescription.para: Sets the condition whether or not the print the problem optimization output files.

parameterdescription.para: A boolean flag indicating whether or not to print the output files.

briefdescription.para: Sets the number of total realizations available. If the vector of realizations is empty, initialize and assign a vector unsigned long integers with length of n_realizations filled with zero values.

parameterdescription.para: An unsigned long integer indicating the number of realizations to run.

briefdescription.para: Sets and limits the number of realizations to be.
Sets the filename suffix for the evaporation and inflow files unique to the problem.

parameterdescription.para: A const string reference to the evaporation and inflow files suffix.

briefdescription.para: Sets the output filename suffix unique to the problem. FIXME: Need to correct function name to fname_suffix.

parameterdescription.para: A const string reference to the filename suffix.

briefdescription.para: If the master_data_collector object is not null, delete it. Then assign it to a nullptr. FIXME: better to rename "deleteDataCollector"?
Prints the timeseries of infrastructure pathways to output folder. Prints utilities, water sources, and policies' time series if indicated as such.

parameterdescription.para: Boolean indicator to print the time series of utilities, water sources, and policies.

briefdescription.para: Read and load pre-computed ROF tables. Also prints the time taken to load the tables.

parameterdescription.para: An integer indicating the number of realizations.
A string containing the directory path for the ROF tables.

briefdescription.para: Takes the -C flag from main.cpp to indicate the ROF table import/export/ignore option.

parameterdescription.para: An integer indicating the ROF table import/export/ignore option. -1: Import tables, 0: Ignore tables, 1: Export tables. Throws error "The value entered is invalid" if the input is not -1, 0, or 1. If import_export_rof_tables is set to IMPORT_ROF_TABLES (-1), assign the ROF tables directory to rof_tables_directory. For all other values, create an ROF tables directory with name rof_tables_directory.
A string containing the directory path for the ROF tables.

memberdef.argsstring: (int standard_solution, int n_sets, int n_bs_samples, int threads, vector< vector< int >> &realizations_to_run)
memberdef.name: runBootstrapRealizationThinning

briefdescription.para: Initializes the output directory of the master data collector and performs bootstrap analysis.

parameterdescription.para: An integer indicating the index of the standard solution.
An integer indicating the number of sets to run.
An integer indicating the number of bootstrap samples to run.
An integer indicating the number of threads to use.
A reference to the 2D vector of integers containing data for the realizations to run.

briefdescription.para: Sets the version number of the problem formulation to use. Formulation 0: Fixed and variable JLWTP options are all considered and independently ordered. Formulation 1: Only fixed JLWTP options are considered and indepedently ordered. Formulation 2: Only variable JLWTP options are considered and indepedently ordered.

parameterdescription.para: An unsigned long integer indicating the formulation number.

briefdescription.para: Sets the filename suffix for the demand files unique to the problem.

parameterdescription.para: A const string reference to the demand files suffix.

briefdescription.para: Sets the subfolder path to the demand files.

parameterdescription.para: A const string reference to the subfolder containing the demand files.

briefdescription.para: The Problem class represents the basic structure of a water management and planning problem.
